column4: Hello. So... I have NTFS partitions and I want to mount them. They are being mounted every time I log in (there are shortcuts to HDB1 etc. on the desktop) but why I try to open them it says that i have no permissions. When I sudo nautilus, it can access them. How can I make it so that I wont need to give nautilus root rights every time I read the partitions?
you can change the permissions for the drive with uid=username (flogee for example)
in fstab
where in the fstab file am I meant to put that uid
yeah, where all the rw, noauto the options
see where it says defaults? put in rw,uid=flogee
see where it says defaults? put in ro,uid=flogee
good to hear. Did you type them in right?
or are you using synaptic
the apt get commands? IO copypasted them from https://wiki.ubuntu.com/RestrictedFormats?highlight=%28restrictedformats%29
better off editing your /etc/apt/sources.list
okay. What line should I edit/add to get multiverse
simple sudo nano (or whatever editor you wnat) /etc/apt/sources.list. at the top will be a line that is commented (ie # at the start) remove those 2 #
it will have something like deb http:/multiverse....
deb http://fi.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu breezy-backports main restricted universe multiverse (and the another line for sources) is only line containing multiverse in my list
how did you install the drivers?
